# TEA

TEA stands for "Tiny Encryption Algorithm", and was created from David J. Wheeler and Roger M. Needham in 1994.

Its implemented in TypeScript and was designed for use in ExpressJS.  
If you don't want to use it as a module simply remove the `export default` in front of the `class`

You can use this algorithm to encrypt and decrypt any text.

You can play around with this implementation [here](https://www.typescriptlang.org/play?#code/PQKhCgAIUgBBDArgFwBYHsBOkDCrMCWAzpAGoCmAduUSQJWQBMADKwLQvMCsUMsA7uQBGRAsnKRUyZAAciALmDB+KgHQBbdADd4QgDbk2yAJ4zyqgMbpViANbAiFwjORFg4+Kqnq9vXnCQ0LEgABSQ9SABlC1R1cgJKAHN-AWFRcUlpOUVgLXIqAgAPABNyLVVEsVREIVUCdD9oSFxUeCSaSHV4UsghY1DwqJi4hMT5f2bINkgAQWLS4sgAFVMaJwIXSCt1GXhkXQI9MWMJ5umAWW6JBOR0SHgtvXhaU6nIYvQLRDjKcWLX6YWAxtciLRAyRowZaoYiPZ4kKy-eAJEhoCRLBL9ACilHWLnqlFmekSWCq6gAFEQMJhkJAALzLLEzACUqgmS1Q6KZkFhDypWFpbUWADNnoLiaS0OpILdIFQrD0he9yAqJOJCsg2dBgOAgfDlpicU5TMgCTMJYQpZAAN7gACQMkIOgyRH2posyr0+3pkGYhQAnOQAMwAdhD-qE-oA3OB7aAIHamggUNSovlcE9aPdEFIsER7dAC3xRLiJMwAIyqbiqFiMctFotwXaYeDSmRPG7kDXQtVd2loPaQfmIPSLRLkWnyzAm0FsxN8ZutyC7Wj8LCLDkSFdENeYRb8KqQfgwmKQYzoRBHw4RIQSXQGGV3UrGzZouW46cuUEyvvkhkxDZORpPtmUbWBMAnRBMEoEhNy2GEZCA9VkD--DKGirZfaEdB0FsKTNEhz2U-LdO2JFsXMAl6XZYLk7NWV6LVfLlmy51yA3aNwbM8sX3yS0DLbD3z2SDZjP2NUPPEkl2f5uP1P+fc3WD7vh-xefyfz7tABfKGdoILICgoSA+awcCaT0HgSk59AFxjAGBQIqZIjphwJmEgSBczEwbDhWAJYLBlkrNWWs9ZLL4MXNKCwgFyDAW7HBWKGFkJngvEeNo-Ynwqk--zQ7hyEJHaOsdeh6ATknO0Kc047JnjnBe+dNnnLmUQ0uLy1l--p-QhkgBBLQxBvx5GJgSFdAA5fIxRWjSgAGSQAAOqcg7nQuiWCLRkkbFQlaKdGCCzDhHcq8A9CIAkPHCwthbq83moLcsjAXYQcgIjE484QqOgIM6CQ-je6qmPkU1J+0MmnzI2NNpzVYlaHQAQRYHtSoTjPD6OF--rvzAX4BBf6G7w3xmTfRasxb+zutHM25c5hnm7nICeb-vtr2NcivkBKzBWbFWz2zZq3VhrA3ButzEd+Dr8AusiR6wkfrTXmpDeKCN2UY2Sr3SmzNubkkZSLefMtqKH0gUba23iXbJVONHZO-xs7F2-U1zYJPqfQ5mICiKsKPZ6MCQkCn1Pv112ky3ewMW0NWZw15h7f97NgO80FsxwuUnQ5hH1PiQOWk45XB90oNe5hdwHgUcwHIyC0FFGEcKtpYdanFdd-NpQtREF-FmImEmK-WUEAuIQgD0KFJILxB0ZnF0N0XuIlO+SkTScJPKPaNpBJVjcqOmEVK5HpUgq2FmdmTmSAftAAHxNU0ksFaEwBwF9hmBQgIHcgiwWTeRFVdUJGIDvXgDvWPncgAH5fRIAUotAx9EFfs+At80wQ0Ht99I1Cx8Ej8KwT9gdz8mxL8Ig4IP82JBwH8EQPoX9vxYC4kv9QEf9hETDADMAad7hbD9DwCnE3Dxo6Fe4kDb87h5oiZ3DGdUD8MWciMPQBVv49ACDSlMBYkb8iDBCoh-9EhVB1V1A8AlJ2DGVBoIg30-RhRhQalqZIAbM3ZctfRChijSiIgbMHJ3JCiaiSjBoyibNGBFoqiijhQSpfUFCA0ght97sw0cwI0fswJtCc1T9yFNCsdL9TJr80jWFLx+AOEwZnoJBERNJ0BfB8FBDf84kXFUA5RHAvUn8di9i5iYBNiLj8IFVWCSBlNTwRNqtaRPVHplx8J9ByB1AnjDwmFrC+wftcM0C--4gA)

## Example

Encode:
```ts
import TEA from './TEA';

const password = 'mySecurePassword';
let plainMessage = 'my message i want to encrypt';

console.log(TEA.encrypt(plainMessage, password));
```

This should output something like `-QûP\u0004¦\bÂ\u001aKÍ!10!àö\u001ciDô¶Ãý÷Olüg»;Ç*üu\u000e`.

Decode:
```ts
import TEA from './TEA'

const password = 'mySecurePassword';
let encryptedMessage = '-QûP\u0004¦\bÂ\u001aKÍ!10!àö\u001ciDô¶Ãý÷Olüg»;Ç*üu\u000e';

console.log(TEA.decrypt(encryptedMessage, password));
```

This should output something like `my message i want to encrypt`.
